item.description:
This latest version of Jane Eyre is getting wonderful reviews. Among its fans are the Boston Phoenix, the Boston Globe, and Roger Ebert. The Boston Phoenix gave the movie four stars, so let's go see it before it disappears from the big screen.

Look for me and my bright red backpack in the lobby of the Somerville Theatre between 6:30 and 6:45 p.m. I'll buy my ticket and wait in the theater lobby for about 15 minutes. At that point, we can move into the theater auditorium (I have to see the previews). The movie itself starts at 7:00 p.m.

If you arrive late, look for me and the bright red backpack in the lobby of the theater after the movie. I'll wait in the lobby for a few minutes after the movie to make sure that we have everyone, and we can decide then if we would like to go out afterward.

One option for tea, food, and conversation after the movie is Mr. Crepe. It's on the same block and the same side of the street as the Somerville Theatre.

If you need more information about the theater, go to http://somervilletheatreonline.com/. (The Somerville Theatre and the Capitol Theatre in Arlington are owned by the same company.) The closest public transportation point is the Davis Square stop on the Red Line of the T.

See you Thursday at the Somerville Theatre!

Marianne
item.how_to_find_us: Look for my bright red backpack. See the event description for more details.
item.name: Last Night for Jane Eyre at the Somerville Theatre
